qas.question: What kind of bodies to insects have?
Insects bodies are supported by what?
Chitin is what kind of outer covering on an insect?
An insect's body is divided into what kind of units?
What is an insects head, throat, and abdomen called?

context: Insects have <a0_0>segmented bodies<a0_0/> supported by <a1_0>exoskeletons<a1_0/>, the <a2_0>hard<a2_0/> outer covering made mostly of chitin. The segments of the body are organized into three distinctive but <a3_0>interconnected<a3_0/> units, or <a4_0>tagmata<a4_0/>: a head, a thorax and an abdomen. The head supports a pair of sensory antennae, a pair of compound eyes, and, if present, one to three simple eyes (or ocelli) and three sets of variously modified appendages that form the mouthparts. The thorax has six segmented legs—one pair each for the prothorax, mesothorax and the metathorax segments making up the thorax—and, none, two or four wings. The abdomen consists of eleven segments, though in a few species of insects, these segments may be fused together or reduced in size. The abdomen also contains most of the digestive, respiratory, excretory and reproductive internal structures.:22–48 Considerable variation and many adaptations in the body parts of insects occur, especially wings, legs, antenna and mouthparts.
